attributes.action: UK Government should encourage and accept the N Ireland First Ministers resignation
attributes.additional_details:
The vast Magority of the N Irelands population want to live in a peaceful pluralist society. At this point in time these people need to have there voices heard and the opportunity to vote for the agreement again or to have a refarendum to give voice to the issues holding N Ireland back.
The current old guard unionist party leadership 14 Years after a war ended are of a mind that it should start over or at the very least was not worth the price paid.
It is obvious from there attitude that they require an enemy to sustaine the milking of the UK Government.
As Peter Robinson is now attempting to blackmail parlament for his parties political gain.
In the interests of Democracy N Ireland would be better off having there elections sooner rather than later.

Peter Robinson should resign.
Northern Ireland requires new elections now.
